intro: Steriphoma venezuelanum, commonly known as the Venezuelan starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically pink or white, and its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
